intro: Beckeropsis uniseta, commonly known as the single-set beckeropsis, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that appear in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Beckeropsis uniseta is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
